results.title: The Business of aging
results.creator_credit: Laszlo Barna, Adam Symansky, Dennis McGann, Fred Tabachnick, Randy Sykes and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This timely film raises the question of who should be entrusted with the care of the elderly and chronically ill—government-run or privately owned nursing homes. The Business of Aging looks into the quality of nursing home care in Canada and presents a sobering picture of residents caught in the financial squeeze as operators attempt to cut overheads at the expense of their patients.

results.title: Women and spirituality
results.creator_credit: Donna Read and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This series looks at the forgotten cultures where goddess-worshipping religions were prevalent, civilisations which were egalitaran and were based on human cooperation.

results.title: Iraq: cradle of civilisation
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton, Central Productions, ITV, Maryland Public Television and Nihon Hoso Kyokai
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Legacy”.
Filmed just before and just after the Gulf War, the first program in this series looks at the effects of “civilisation” on the landscape, and the rise and fall of civilisations, particularly in relation to Iraq where civilisation began. The first cities were built 5000 years ago on the banks of the Euphrates in Southern Iraq, and city life soon transformed the human race with the glorious cultures of Mesopotamia such as Ur, Nineveh and Babylon. Michael Woods explores these ancient cultures and the legacy they gave to the history of Iraq right up to the Gulf War. The program is presented in two parts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Spry-Leverton, Central Productions, ITV, Maryland Public Television and Nihon Hoso Kyokai

results.title: The Burden of time
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton, Central Productions, ITV, Maryland Public Television and Nihon Hoso Kyokai
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Legacy”.
Central American civilisation developed quite independently from those of the rest of the world, yet bears striking resemblances to other great civilisations, from the great pyramids it built, and the invention of writing to the relationship of man, earth and the heavens, expressed in ritual and “the mathematics of eternity”. In spite of the disastrous past 500 years of history, the descendants of the Maya and the Aztecs have kept faith with their burden of time, through their shamen, and their blend of Christianity and the old religions, in spite of the pressures of western consumer society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Spry-Leverton, Central Productions, ITV, Maryland Public Television and Nihon Hoso Kyokai

results.title: The Stress Factor/ a Crime Called Violence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “The Stress Factor” Andrew Denton and his teenage laboratory technicians identify and examine stress, its causes and effects along with methods of dealing with it. Andrew Denton and a panel of teenagers discuss the perpetrators and victims in “A Crime Called Violence”. Methods of coping with violence inflicted by peers and the reason behind their aggression are discussed by the group from their first hand experiences.

results.title: The Breakthrough series
results.brief_description: An award winning series of eight films, aimed at adolescents, dealing with violence, stress, divorce, step-parents, death, racism, conflict and political action. The issues are presented in an entertaining and direct manner, hopefully leading to empowerment rather than a feeling of hopelessness.

results.title: Hit and Miss/One Voice
results.creator_credit: Pip Karmel, Stephen Ramsey, Pamela Williams and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “Hit and Miss” we meet Adam, dealing with the pressures of school and family. The resulting conflict is resolved in a constructive way. A teenager who decides to take part in an anti-logging protest is featured in “One Voice” Amber is ostracised by her peers, but supported by her parents. Watch her confidence increase as she pursues her beliefs undeterred by the attitudes of her peers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pip Karmel, Stephen Ramsey, Pamela Williams and Ron Saunders

results.title: In Loving Memory. Alice
results.creator_credit: Michael Riley, Pamela Williams, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In Loving Memory - we meet Mary who develops cancer in primary school, and see the effects that the illness and treatment have on her life. Mary examines her relationship with family and friends and the value she puts on life. In “Alice” we meet an Aboriginal teenager who is subjected to racism, both at school and in the community. The effects of prejudice are seen as we eavesdrop on her thoughts and watch her achieve her ambitions despite the attacks on her self confidence.

results.title: Dad's Girl/Common Ground
results.creator_credit: Judy Menczel, Martin Daley, Pamela Williams and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “Dad’s Girl” we meet Janea who lives with her mother and still misses her father years after the divorce. She discusses the effect of her parents’ divorce on her life. In “Common Ground”, Sean’s experience of his parents’ divorce and his new step-father are shown along with the changes he makes to adapt to his new family situation.
